name: Fat Quarter Skrappysak - An easy-to-make shoulder bag made with fat quarters
description:
Six fat quarters will make a bag and just two fat quarters will make it’s “friend” (the little bag). The Fat Quarter Skrappysak features two outside pockets, two inside pockets, a Velcro tab for closure and an adjustable shoulder tab. It’s long enough to wear as a shoulder bag and short enough to carry by hand. It looks small but holds a lot – and with one more fat quarter, you can add an optional cell phone pocket. A thin batting is used.

The Friend comes in two sizes and is worn across the body, almost like an accessory, or can hang from the shoulder. Perfect for when you need just your lipstick and charge card. 

Paper patterns for the bags are included.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Skrappysak - A large roomy shoulder bag in two sizes
description:
Skrappysak is a large roomy shoulder bag which is comfortable to wear and easy to make. The pattern features 1) two sizes - Big – 15” wide and Really Big – 22” wide, 2) three styles, 3) outside pockets for keys, glasses, etc. and 4) inside pockets for wallet, lipstick, etc. A quick and terrific project for using your scraps. A thin batting is used.

Paper patterns for both sizes is included.

The pattern is designed by Ellen Hauben

name: Totesalot - carry your laptop, baby paraphernalia, or quilting supplies
description:
Whatta Bag! Make it sophisticated or make it scrappy. Carry your laptop computer, or your quilting supplies, or your baby paraphernalia. The Totesalot features 1) four outside pockets including two with elastic and one that expands, 2) four inside pockets (Velcro one of the pockets to keep your wallet safe), 3) inside tabs to hang your keys (or baby’s pacifier) and 4) an inside divider to make one half of the bag business and one half pleasure, or one half baby’s and one half mom’s. A thin batting is used.

The easy-to follow-directions have you cut various rectangles, binding and voila! It’s a bag!

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Baggitt - a cute shoulder bag in two sizes
description:
Baggitt is a shoulder bag which comes in two sizes, 12” by 14” or 8” by 10” (Little Baggitt). It has outside and inside pockets, a Velcro tab for closure and is very quick to make. A thin batting is used.

The easy-to-follow directions have you cut various rectangle and voila! It’s a bag!

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman

name: Phlipphlap Bag - a fun to make bag using many fabrics
description:
The Phlipphlap Bag boasts two totally separate compartments, inside and outside pockets including an optional cell phone pocket and the opportunity to combine between five and twelve different fabrics for a phabulous look. The long phlap phlips over for closure and if you want to really secure your possessions, phlip the larger back phlap over. Use fabric or cording for the strap, and embellish with buttons, tassels and/or phabric triangles.

The shoulder bag measures 12" wide by 13.5". The travel bag measures 20" wide by 16" -- perfect for carrying a laptop or quilting or travel essentials.

The easy-to-follow directions have you cut various rectangles which assemble into a bag.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Two Inone Tote - features two separate but attached shoulder bags
description:
The Two Inone Tote features two separate but attached shoulder bags, inside and outside pockets and the opportunity to combine between three to eight different fabrics for your own unique look. The strap is attached with covered metal rings. The tabs flip over for closure and may be embellished with buttons, tassels and/or smaller covered metal rings.

The larget tote measures 13" wide by 12" , just right for an everyday bag. The smaller tote measures 8 1/2" wide by 7 1/2", perfect for an evening bag.

name: Accessor Eaze - a wearable eyeglass case, a small shoulder bag, and a cumberbund
description:
The Accessor Eaze patterns includes a wearable fabric-collage eyeglass case for reading glasses or sun glasses, a small tassled shoulder bag and a cummerbund belt which are all easy to make and a wonderful way to use your extra scraps. A thin batting is used.

Paper patterns for all three items are included.

The pattern is designed by Ellen Hauben

name: Tote Trio - a sling pack shoulder bag, a back pack or a supertote - all in one
description:
The Tote Trio is a sling pack (shoulder bag or a it’s a back pack or a supertote! Make one Tote Trio, and then use the bag in three different ways by changing how it is snapped closed and by changing how the straps are buttoned. An outside pocket with Velcro™ on the flap provides extra storage. Lots of buttons add interest. And it’s sooo quick and easy to make!

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Thisissa Vest - features long, graceful curved pieced lines
description:
Thisissa Vest features long, graceful, curved pieced lines, button-pleated shoulders, piping, split sides, and a choice of two lengths. The back of the knee length version is completely strip-pieced. The back of the fingertip length version uses a focus fabric which is used on the front. Complete instructions for curved piecing are included in the pattern. The vest is completely lined.

The directions are sized from 4 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Sosimpel Vest - a long vest with open sides
description:
The Sosimpel Vest features long straight lines and open sides with closures adjustable to your own figure. The directions offer a variety of choices to make this vest uniquely yours. Make it in one fabric or many, in patchwork or not; make it quilted or not, reversible or not. Six different ideas are given for side closures.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 6 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Anotha Vest Anmor Pants
description:
An elegant and easy vest in two lengths – long and longer. The vest is very easy to make. The bottom of the pant legs can be embellished to coordinate with the vest. The pants have an elastic waist with a flat front. Full size tissue pattern included for sizes Small to Xlarge.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Acute Vest and Wonseam Pants - the vest really is CUTE
description:
The Acute Vest features front tabs for closure, back ties and is a snap to make. It can be dressed up with fancy threads or made casually with denims and plaids. The vest is lined and could be reversible. The Wonseam Pants are the easiest (one seam) and most comfortable pants you’ll ever make. They feature an elastic waist, inverted pleats, and full culotte pants, giving the appearance of a long skirt. Cut them shorter for a cropped look and even shorter for a knee length split skirt.

The tissue paper pattern for the vest is sized from 6 to 20. The pants are sized Small/Medium and Large/XLarge. Without pleats, the pants with fit up to a 42” waist.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Ikinmakit Vest - flattering to both small and large sizes
description:
This long, flaired vest is flattering to both large and small figures. A fold back neckline and large pockets add interest. The bodice can be made with one fabric or with curved strip piecing and decorative couched threads. Use one button for a tunic vest or button it all the way down for a short jumper. The bodice is completely lined and the “skirt” is unlined.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 6 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Wonsizfitz Almostall - one size really does fit almost all
description:
Wonsizfitz Almostall is an attractive, loose fitting, unlined jacket which may be pulled over the head or buttoned. On a small person, it hangs in points at the sides. On a larger person, the hem line hangs straight across.

The one-size tissue paper pattern will fit anyone from size 6 to 20 (honest!). The sleeve pattern is sized from Small (6-8) to XXL (22).

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Haftadu Coat - easiest of the "du" coats
description:
The Haftadu Coat is the easiest of Nancy’s “du” coat patterns. Start it in the morning, wear it out to dinner, and still have time for lunch and laundry. You can make one for every holiday! The coat uses a thin layer of batting, so it is a great light-weight outdoor coat.

The directions are sized from 4 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman..

name: Aponcha - a poncho/jacket in two lengths
description:
Is it a poncho? Is it a jacket? Yes, to both questions! Aponcha is loose fitting like a poncho, but is tacked under the arm and at the wrist for a slightly more fitted look. Make it hip length or longer, opened down the front or pull it over your head. Add a personalized scarf or crushed “flower” to embellish your Aponcha.

The tissue paper is sized from XS to XXL.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Butonit Coat - designed for sizes 1X to 5X
description:
The Butonit Coat is specifically created for sizes 1X to 5X (see Butonit Coat Too for smaller sizes). This unlined coat features 1) comfort and style, 2) front panels and a back patchwork panel which create interest and long, flattering lines, and 3) stacked buttons for decoration and loops for closure.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 1X to 5X.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Gottadu Coat - show off one fabulous fabrics or six
description:
The Gottadu Coat is an easy-to-wear garment with kimono-styled sleeves and split sides. It’s a wonderful coat to show off one fabulous fabric or six terrific fabrics. It can be made finger-tipped length or knee length, cuffed or not. The coat is only two layers of fabric, so it can be worn indoors or out.

The directions are sized from 4 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Kandu Coat - a wonderful finger-tip length coat made from many fabrics
description:
The directions for this wonderful finger-tip length coat include 1) instructions for selecting fabric to shade the coat from light to dark or from one color to another, 2) easy to follow sewing instructions appropriate for anyone with minimal sewing experience, and 3) directions for Kandu Coat Too, a full length Kandu Coat which uses an accent fabric and piping. A layer of muslin between the coat and lining give this coat body and a slight bit of warmth.

The directions are sized from 6 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Hooded Orknot Coat - a knee length coat with wonderful details
description:
Pick out five to eight fabrics, cut a bunch of rectangles, interline with a batting and you’re ready to meet the world in this beautiful coat. Make it with a buttoned-on hood or not, your choice. This knee length coat has wonderful details such as trimmed pockets, three dimensional tabs for closure and styling, and a detailed back yoke.

The directions are sized from 4 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Butonit Coat Too and Vest - slightly A-line coat or vest with an over panel
description:
The Butonit Coat Too and Vest (both are included in the pattern) are loose fitting, slightly A-line garments with a front and back over-panel. The bottom of the front over-panel may be cut on a slant or straight across. A pieced pocket and lots of decorative buttons add interest. The coat is unlined and may be worn indoors or as a light outer coat.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 6 to 22.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Jumpina Jumper (or Dress) - roomy and flattering
description:
Jumpina Jumper (or Dress) is a comfortable fitting garment that is roomy and flattering to wear. Inverted pleats and a side panel add a slimming long line to the skirt. The bodice is designed to fall a little below the natural waistline and is completely lined. The sleeves for the dress fit over the angled armhole which creates an interesting design. A back tie allows for a little more shaping.

Make a matching jumper for your daughter with Alittel Jumper pattern.

The tissue paper patterns is sized from 4 to 20.

The pattern is designed by Ellen Hauben.

name: Alittel Jumper - a little girl's version of Mommy's Jumpina Jumper
description:
This pattern is a little girl's version of the Jumpina Jumper pattern. It's adorable in bright cottons or make it in other fabrics to match Mom's Jumpina Jumper. Like Mom's Jumper, this design is classic, comfy and fun to wear. A back tie allows for a little more shaping.

The tissue paper pattern is for sizes 2 to 10.

The pattern is designed by Ellen Hauben.

name: Patchwerky Pants - easy and comfortable
description:
Elastic waist, flat front with pleats, side pockets, slightly tapered leg, and easy to make! What could be better? Make these pants elegant with patches down the right side, make them fun by using up your scraps for totally patched pants, or make them in one fabric because they easy, comfortable, and good looking.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from Small (6-8) to XLarge (18).

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Long Short & Great Tee - "shorts" for those who can't wear short shorts
description:
Finally! Shorts designed for non-teeny-bopper people! The Long Short is comfortably sized with an elastic waist, flat pleated front and side pockets. The length is about 3” above the knee. The tee shirt sleeves can be rolled up or left long to reach just above the elbow.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from Small (6-8) to XXLarge (22).

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Myeziest Vest -  an easy to make vest with MANY options
description:
Myeziest Vest is a simple vest to make with many options. The hardest part will be deciding which options you want to choose! The pattern features three different necklines and four different side possibilities. You can piece the front and back, or create a longer line by not piecing. The cropped top can be made reversible. The other styles are completely lined and could be reversible if desired.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 6 to 20.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman and Ellen Hauben.

name: Nonaim Coat
description:
The Nonaim Coat is a loose fitting, flared back, unlined garment with finished French seams. It is an elegant compliment for any skirt or pant in your wardrobe. The coat pattern has a choice of two lengths, two back options, and optional pocket and trims.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 6 to 20.

The pattern is designed by Ellen Hauben

name: Crazy 'Boutcha Bomber - a short bomber jacket
description:
Go crazy with this easy-to-wear bomber style jacket. The jacket is waist length and is a very easy construction. The pattern includes complete instructions on how to crazy quilt.

The tissue paper pattern is sized from 8 to 20.

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: The Hap Quilt - Lap or Wall Quilt, or Pillow
description:
The Hap Quilt was a utilitarian quilt made in the late 19th century in Pennsylvania with scraps of wool, but it can be delightfully adapted to today’s fabric. Make it with plaids, Amish solids, bright contemporary fabrics – or scraps! The trick is knowing how to mix the fabrics, which the pattern explains.

The pattern has sizes for a wall quilt 36" x 36", a lap quilt 45" x 63" or a pillow 18" x 18".

The pattern is designed by Nancy Mirman.

name: Pop 'N Roll Quilt - bed or lap quilt using Bali Pops or Jelly Rolls
description:
The Pop 'N Roll Quilt is a pattern for a bed or lap quilt which uses a Bali Pop or Jelly Roll. The quilt as pictured is 53" by 79"; the pattern also has instructions for a lap, twin, queen or king size quilt. It is a very easy patten to sew and a perfect quilt for those scrumptious Pops or Rolls that you bought and don't know how to use!

Pattern designed by Nancy Mirman

name: Art Nouveau Garden
description: 16 Art Nouveau floral designs that fit in an 8 1/2 inch block. Us these designs in seven projects ranging from quilts and wall hangings to tote bags and pillows.

name: Art Nouveau Blooms Again
description: Six profects using Art Nouveau designs created with repeating patterns or patterns that flow into and connect with each other. The projects include bed and wall quilts, frammed appliques, tassled pillow and a tablerunner.

name: A Place at the Table
description: Easy, elegant place mats and table runners! Use a variety of techniques to make 17 different placemat desigsn or 7 different table runner designs. Strip piecing, straight stitch topstitching, simple machhine applique, big stitch quilting and fusible web are some of the quick and easy methods used. The projects range from easy to really easy and are quick enough to make for gifts on the go.

name: A Constellation of Stars
description: Paper pieced patterns for seventeen 12" blocks and eighteen 5" blocks. The patterns are full sized. The difficulty level is ranges from easy to more difficult and is indicated by one, two or three thimble icons. Complete directions are included from fabric selection, to paper piecing, to binding. There are directions for making any size quilt from a lap to king size.

name: Memory Keepsakes
description: Turn a wonderful (or just plain loved) piece of clothing into a pillow or soft sculptured work of art. From the familiar to the funny to the fanciful, ten articles of clothing are transformed into eyecatching creative pillows. Create your unique pillow with personality! This book will tell you how.
